column4: How do I install drivers for my wireless card?  I went to System > Administration > Hardware Drivers and clicked "Activate" for the driver, and it told me it was downloading and installing the driver, but the bar never got past 0% and the card still doesn't show up in "ifconfig -a".
have you downloaded all updates first?

I just installed Ubuntu, haven't done anything else.  Am I going to have to do an update to get the wireless drivers?  I was hoping to use the wireless card somewhere to do the update because of connection speed.
i have seen a few cases where you needed to get updates first..
That's too bad.  I guess I can always let it run overnight for a couple days...
dial-up?
Unfortunately.
cant run a cat5 cable?
I can, but where do I hook the other end?  A place with free wireless Internet is where I was going to use the wireless card.
possible to take to a friend's just to get the updates?
I suppose I can.
Mostly, I installed Ubuntu to see if the wireless card would work with little trouble, so I could keep Ubuntu if so : )  If I have to update first, I'll try that.
i know, its a pain, but i was lucky i could here, but that was with 8.10, what did you install?
8.10 'cause that's the CD I had.
and what wireless card you have?
BCM4328
try 9.04 if you can get it
It doesn't have that problem?  I should, if that's the case.
8.10 was terrible IMO, especially with the initial wireless,,,
Okay.
and mine did same with BCM43XX
Okay.  Thanks for helping.
if i'm not here you  can find me on #seaphor
Okay.
